page.title: 01HOY
page.content:
This area of central Hoy is mountainous unlike the rest of Orkney. There are 3 major peaks here with an average height of 360 metres. the mountains are eroded by several burns and there is evidence of Glacial erosion. The whole area is rough moorland covered with Heather, some grass and large areas of Peat Bog. Wild Orchids grown here in abundance. The tops of the hills suffer heavily from frost damage, so consequently there is little vegetation very high up.
The bird life here included curlews, oystercatchers and artic skuas.
